cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 270 miles SSW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW for the next 24 h then forecast to turn sharply north toward Hispaniola, eventually moving into the southwest Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern coast of the Dominican Republic (near Isla Saona‐Cabo Beata area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Haiti entire south coast and Dominican Republic south coast eastward to Isla Saona
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, and adjacent Caribbean waters
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible, but sustained TS winds are unlikely (≤9% chance)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the north-facing San Juan coastline
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain 2–4 inches with localized higher totals could cause minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and rip currents beginning Monday night through Wednesday
